decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to quickly and aggressively lower your own life total to maximize the power of Death's Shadow, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with hand disruption and counterspells. The deck utilizes efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and Gurmag Angler to apply pressure, with backup from disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Force of Will. Additionally, Reanimate can be used to bring back key creatures from the graveyard. The deck aims to control the game early on and finish off the opponent with a big Death's Shadow or other threats.

The main concept of this Grixis Aggro deck is to have early game disruption and removal spells to control the board, while also utilizing efficient creatures like Young Pyromancer, True-Name Nemesis, Delver of Secrets, and Gurmag Angler to pressure the opponent and close out the game quickly. The deck aims to tempo the opponent by countering key spells with Force of Will and Daze, while also keeping the board clear with Lightning Bolt and other removal spells. The deck is built to be efficient, aggressive, and disruptive to give the player a strong advantage in the early and mid-game.

This Grixis Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while deploying threats of its own. By using a combination of counterspells, targeted removal, and hand disruption spells, the deck aims to control the pace of the game and prevent the opponent from executing their strategy. The deck also includes powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Liliana, the Last Hope, along with efficient creatures like Snapcaster Mage and Gurmag Angler to close out the game once it has gained control.

The primary focus of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures such as Griselbrand and Tidespout Tyrant, utilizing cards like Entomb, Faithless Looting, and Cabal Therapy. By utilizing reanimation spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead, the deck aims to bring these creatures back onto the battlefield at a low cost. The inclusion of disruptive spells like Unmask and Chancellor of the Annex helps to protect the combo while disrupting the opponent's game plan. Overall, the deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures.

The main concept of this Legacy 1 vs 1 deck focuses on quickly assembling the necessary pieces for a powerful Storm combo. By utilizing cards like Lotus Petal, Lion's Eye Diamond, Dark Ritual, and Cabal Ritual to generate mana, along with cantrips like Preordain and Ponder to dig for key cards, the deck aims to generate a critical mass of mana and spells before finishing the game with Tendrils of Agony. The inclusion of graveyard recursion cards like Past in Flames enhances the deck's resilience and ability to go off multiple times in a single turn.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive threats like Delver of Secrets, Gurmag Angler, and True-Name Nemesis while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Inquisition of Kozilek and Daze. The deck also includes a suite of powerful card selection spells like Ponder and Brainstorm, along with removal like Lightning Bolt and Fatal Push. The mana base is streamlined with efficient dual lands and Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's mana base. The goal of the deck is to apply pressure quickly while disrupting the opponent's strategy, ultimately winning through a combination of aggression and disruption.

The main focus of this Legacy 1 vs 1 Combo Dredge deck is to fill the graveyard quickly and efficiently in order to get creatures onto the battlefield from the graveyard, trigger Bridge from Below, and overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of creatures. The deck utilizes cards like Faithless Looting and Careful Study to discard cards and draw into combo pieces, while also using Cephalid Coliseum and Breakthrough to further fuel the graveyard. By utilizing the dredge mechanic and sacrificing creatures with Cabal Therapy, the deck aims to create a formidable board presence and win the game through graveyard shenanigans.

The deck revolves around quickly generating mana with elves and using spells like Glimpse of Nature and Green Sun's Zenith to find combo pieces. The key strategy is to get enough mana to cast Natural Order, sacrificing a creature to tutor for Craterhoof Behemoth, which gives all creatures a massive power boost and usually allows for a game-winning attack. The deck also has ways to bounce and replay creatures for additional mana generation and card draw. It relies on explosive turns and overwhelming board presence to win the game before the opponent can respond.

This Legacy 1 vs 1 deck focuses on aggressive plays with a mixture of disruptive elements to control the opponent's resources. By combining early threats like Mother of Runes and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben with disruptive cards like Phyrexian Revoker and Sanctum Prelate, the deck aims to pressure the opponent while slowing down their game plan. Aether Vial allows for quick creature deployment while cards like Flickerwisp and Palace Jailer provide additional disruption. The deck also includes powerful equipment like Batterskull and Sword of Fire and Ice to further enhance its aggressive strategy.

The main concept of this UWx Control deck is to control the game by utilizing counterspells, removal spells, and powerful planeswalkers such as Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria. The deck aims to create card advantage through cards like Accumulated Knowledge and Brainstorm, while also leveraging the lock pieces Counterbalance and Back to Basics to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck's win condition is to establish control of the board and finish the game with incremental advantage or powerful sweepers like Supreme Verdict.

This deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly using powerful lands like Cloudpost and Glimmerpost, alongside ramp spells like Thran Dynamo and Grim Monolith. The key strategy is to play out large Eldrazi creatures such as Endbringer, Thought-Knot Seer, and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger as quickly as possible to overwhelm the opponent with their powerful abilities and high stats. Cards like Karn, Scion of Urza and Sorcerous Spyglass provide additional utility and disruption, while Chalice of the Void helps control the opponent's spells. Overall, the deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain board dominance with its massive creatures.

The deck utilizes the synergy between Life from the Loam and Knight of the Reliquary to control the game by recurring lands and disrupting the opponent's resources. Additionally, it uses the mana ramp provided by Mox Diamond and Orcish Lumberjack to power out powerful threats like Titania, Protector of Argoth and Dragonlord Atarka. The inclusion of Punishing Fire offers removal options, while Green Sun's Zenith provides toolbox flexibility. Overall, the deck focuses on resource management and resilience to outlast opponents in a longer game.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the Dredge mechanic to fill the graveyard with key creatures like Prized Amalgam, Narcomoeba, and Ichorid, while also triggering effects from cards like Bridge from Below. By using cards like Faithless Looting and Breakthrough to cycle through the deck quickly, the player aims to bring back multiple creatures from the graveyard in one turn to overwhelm the opponent. This deck relies on synergy between cards like Golgari Thug, Golgari Grave-Troll, and Street Wraith to quickly assemble a lethal board state and win the game.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of land destruction, land manipulation, and recurring spells. By creating a lock with cards like Thespian's Stage and Dark Depths, the deck can quickly generate a powerful token creature. Utilizing cards like Wasteland and Rishadan Port, the deck disrupts the opponent's mana base while maintaining its own resources with Life from the Loam. With the ability to search for specific lands with Crop Rotation and explosive plays with Gamble, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent in a slow, grindy game.

The deck focuses on resource denial and controlling the game through the use of land destruction with cards like Wasteland and Ghost Quarter, supported by Life from the Loam to recur lands. It also utilizes hand disruption with cards like Liliana of the Veil and Thoughtseize, along with removal spells such as Punishing Fire and Abrupt Decay. Additionally, it includes threats like Knight of the Reliquary and Dark Confidant to pressure opponents while generating card advantage. The deck seeks to grind out opponents with efficient removal and resilient threats.

The main focus of this Grixis Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan with a variety of disruptive spells such as Force of Will, Hymn to Tourach, Inquisition of Kozilek, and Thoughtseize, while also controlling the board with removal spells like Lightning Bolt, Fatal Push, and Diabolic Edict. The deck also aims to generate card advantage through cards like Snapcaster Mage and Jace, the Mind Sculptor, and close out the game with powerful threats like Gurmag Angler and Baleful Strix. Additionally, the deck utilizes a mix of dual lands and fetch lands to ensure consistent mana production.
